result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis J Dronso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:10am [mo]
Defendant Dennis J Dronso in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #2 and #3; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Counts #2 and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 15 months, with conditions:

--No Contact with Ashley Morgan per Agent and any other Court's order. 
--no acts or threats of violence
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming, if recommended by Agent
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--random drug screening
--to pay statutory costs, to include domestic abuse surcharge

The Court finds that Mr. Dronso has already submitted a DNA sample.


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess:10:32am
Duplicate Original Warrant and Warrant Cancellation Notice returned from JESO
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 2:37pm [mo]
Defendant Dennis J Dronso in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court considers the warrant to be executed based on the appearance on Mr. Dronso; should be removed from any database
Atty. Laitsch gives explanation for Mr. Dronso's non appearance; Mr. Dronso was informed by Atty. Laitsch's office that he was not required to attend hearing
Atty. Laitsch requests bond be reinstated; no objection from ADA Teuber

The Court reinstates established bond

Atty. Laitsch requests a Plea/Sentencing hearing be scheduled; indicates have coordinated with Clerk to obtain hearing date.
The Clerk announces date for the record.

ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance
recess:2:42pm

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 6/17/16 at 10:00am

Case called at 10:41am [mo]
Defendant Dennis J Dronso not in court.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court recites fax submitted by Atty. Laitsch's office, indicating that he is ill and would be unable to attend hearings today
The Court notes that the fax does not give excuse for Mr. Dronso's non appearance

The Court reviews the Court Record
The Court finds bond to be in default and order is to be forfeit
The Court issues a bench warrant, body only.

recess: 10:45am
Fax transmittal from Laitsch Law Office re: Attorney Laitsch will be unable to appear at the 10 am Status in Branch 3 on 4-5-2016
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for 2/17/16 PTC (2)NOH for 4/5/16 STC//sent to LKA

Case called at 4:03pm [mo]
Defendant Dennis J Dronso in court with attorney Thomas J Laitsch.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr. Dronso  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no demand for speedy trial
recess: 4:09pm

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on  2/17/16 at 9:00am  (2) Status Conference on 4/5/16 at 10:00am
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for 1/21/16 Preliminary Hearing//sent to LKA
from Attorney Laitsch providing address for defendant

Defendant Dennis J Dronso in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Laitsch indicates that he has yet to receive Discovery from the State; requests a Preliminary Hearing date.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 9:14am


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 1/21/16 at 4:00pm
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for 10/20/15 Adjourned Initial Appearance//sent to LKA; Hearing date has past, Defendant did appear at AIA on 10/20/15; Defendant has an 'other' address also
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Discovery and Inspection
State's Notice of Intent to Admit Certified Medical Records with cover letter
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for 11/18/15 PTC (2)NOH for 12/29/15 STC//sent to LKa

Case called at 2:30pm [mo]
Defendant Dennis J Dronso in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the Court Record
The Court verifies Mr. Dronso's address and date of birth as listed on the Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

recess: 2:36pm

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/18/15 at 10:00am   (2) Status Conference on 12/29/15 at 9:00am

Case called at 11:09 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for initial appearance)
Defendant Dennis J Dronso in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Dronso indicates that he will be hiring Atty Laitsch and that Atty Laitsch indicated that he could not appear in front of Judge Hue bacause they were related - Atty Laitsch advised him to appear today and have the matter set for future hearings.
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Dronso requests to have initial appearance with Atty Laitsch in front of Judge Wambach
DA Happ requests concerns about not setting additional bond conditions at this time
Court inquires if Judge Koschnick may be available to conduct initial appearance today
off-record: 11:11 - 11:19 am for Clerk to inquire if Judge Koschnick is available
Court informs parties that Branch IV will conduct the initial appearance today at 11:50 am 
Recess: 11:19 am 

NEXT: Initial Appearance BrIV at 11:50 am  - Send notices

Case recalled at 11:57 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Dennis J Dronso in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Dronso confirms that he will be retaining Atty Laitsch for this matter
DA Happ informs the Court that she contacted Atty Laitsch and he indicated that he was understanding that Mr. Dronso would be appearing today and matter would be set for futher proceedings

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $500 cash bond, already posted, with conditions:
-Abide by terms of injunction
-No contact with Ashley Morgan
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No acts/threats of violence
-No possession of dangerous weapons
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 12:04 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 10/20/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
